Class Neuron

  • java.lang.Object
    • Neuron
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Inp

    public class Neuron
extends java.lang.Object
implements Inp

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Neuron()
      Instantiates a new neuron with empty lists of inputs, weights, and names.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addInput(Inp n, double w)
      Add a neuron to the inputs list with a given weight.
      void changeWeight(Inp n, double w)
      Changes the weight from this neuron to another, adding that neuron if necessary.
      double getLastOutput()
      Returns the last output that this neuron computed.
      java.lang.String getName()
      returns the name of this neuron.
      double getOutput(int code)
      Gets the output of this neuron, which implicitly calculates the outputs of all the neurons below, unless the given code is the same as the prior code (indicating that a complete recompute is not necessary).
      double getWeight(Neuron n)
      Returns the weight from this neuron to a different neuron, and throws an exception if that neuron is not connected to this.
      void setName(java.lang.String n)
      Sets the name of this neuron.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Neuron

        public Neuron()
        Instantiates a new neuron with empty lists of inputs, weights, and names.

    • Method Detail

      • setName

        public void setName(java.lang.String n)
        Sets the name of this neuron.
        Parameters:
        n - name to give this neuron.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        returns the name of this neuron.
        Returns:
        the name of this neuron.

      • addInput

        public void addInput(Inp n,
            double w)
        Add a neuron to the inputs list with a given weight. If the neuron is already in the inputs list, set the weight to the given value.
        Parameters:
        n - Neuron to add
        w - Weight to set

      • changeWeight

        public void changeWeight(Inp n,
                double w)
        Changes the weight from this neuron to another, adding that neuron if necessary. The input w is a weight delta that is added to the original weight.
        Parameters:
        n - Input to change weight from this neuron to.
        w - Amount to change weight by.

      • getOutput

        public double getOutput(int code)
        Gets the output of this neuron, which implicitly calculates the outputs of all the neurons below, unless the given code is the same as the prior code (indicating that a complete recompute is not necessary).
        Specified by:
        getOutput in interface Inp
        Parameters:
        code - an integer code denoting whether a new computation is necessary.
        Returns:
        the output from this neuron.

      • getLastOutput

        public double getLastOutput()
        Returns the last output that this neuron computed.
        Returns:
        the last output that this neuron computed.

      • getWeight

        public double getWeight(Neuron n)
        Returns the weight from this neuron to a different neuron, and throws an exception if that neuron is not connected to this.
        Parameters:
        n - Neuron to return weight to.
        Returns:
        weight to the given neuron
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - when given neuron n is not connected to this.
